definition[0]: to produce something, for example by putting the different parts of it together
example[0]: I’m going to show you how to make a box for your tools.
example[1]: A family of mice had made their nest in the roof.
example[2]: She made her own wedding dress.
example[3]: The company has been making quality furniture for over 200 years.
example[4]: They met while they were making a film.
example[5]: Make a list of all the things you need.
example[6]: He made her a toy horse, using just some straw and bamboo twigs.
example[9]: She’s very good at making things from old scraps of material.
definition[1]: used with some nouns to say that someone does something
example[11]: I can’t make a decision just yet.
example[12]: I need to make a quick phone call.
example[13]: You could have made more effort to talk to him.
example[14]: He made no attempt to apologize.
example[16]: There are a few points I’d like to make.
example[17]: The police were called but no arrests were made.
example[18]: I suppose we should make a start on cleaning this room.
definition[2]: to cook or prepare food or drink
example[20]: When was the last time you made a cake?
example[21]: John was making breakfast in the kitchen.
example[22]: Who’s going to make the tea?
definition[3]: to cause something to happen, or cause a particular state or condition
example[24]: Its beautiful beaches make this a highly popular area with tourists.
example[25]: It was this movie which made him a star.
example[26]: His attitude made him very unpopular with colleagues.
example[27]: The photo makes her look much older than she really is.
example[28]: The president has made it clear that he is not going to change his mind.
example[29]: The use of computers has made it possible for more people to work from home.
example[30]: Over 80,000 people attended, making it the biggest sporting event in the area.
note[5]: make something the best/worst/most expensive etc
example[31]: I like him because he makes me laugh.
explanation[0]: In written English, people often use cause somebody to do something rather than make somebody do something, as it sounds more formal:
example[32]: His attitude caused him to be unpopular with colleagues.
definition[4]: to force someone to do something
example[33]: My parents always make me do my homework before I go out.
example[34]: I was made to wait four hours before I was examined by a doctor.
definition[5]: to cause a mark, hole etc to appear
example[35]: Make a hole in the paper.
example[36]: The cup has made a mark on the table.
definition[6]: to succeed in achieving a particular position, rate etc
example[37]: He was never good enough to make the team.
example[38]: I don’t think we’ll make the deadline.
example[39]: The plan could cost you more than you would make.
example[40]: They made a profit of £140 million.
example[41]: His one aim in life was to make money.
example[42]: She hopes to make a living (=earn the money she needs to live) from writing children’s books.
example[43]: He’s made a fortune (=earned a lot of money) selling computers on the Internet.
example[44]: How easy is it to make money out of gardening?
definition[8]: to have the qualities that are necessary for a particular job, use, or purpose
example[45]: I’m sure you will make a very good teacher.
example[46]: The hall would make an ideal venue for a wedding reception.
example[47]: An old cardboard box makes a comfortable bed for a kitten.
explanation[1]: Make is a linking verb in this meaning It links the subject of the sentence with an adjective and noun
example[49]: The leaves make a pretty table decoration
definition[9]: to be a particular amount when added together
example[51]: There are nine people coming, plus me, which makes ten.
definition[10]: used to say what you have calculated a number to be
definition[11]: to achieve a particular score in a sports game
definition[12]: to arrive at or get to a particular place, especially when it is difficult
example[54]: I don’t think we’re going to make the town before nightfall.
definition[13]: to make something complete or successful
explanation[2]: You use this when saying which material is used to make something The material has not been changed and can still be recognized
example[56]: The table is made of wood
example[57]: The ring was made of solid gold
explanation[3]: You use this especially when the materials used to make something have been completely changed and cannot be recognized
example[58]: The drink is made from cherries
explanation[4]: You use this when saying who makes something
example[60]: The pots are made by local craftsmen
explanation[5]: You also use this when saying how something is made
example[61]: Tar is made by heating coal to a high temperature
definition[14]: used about things you make yourself, or things that are made in a factory
example[62]: Diane makes all her own clothes.
example[63]: My camera was made in China.
definition[15]: to make something in large quantities to be sold, or to make something as the result of a natural process
example[65]: Japan produces some of the most advanced mobile phones.
example[66]: The pancreas is a gland in your body which produces hormones.
definition[16]: to make something new and original
example[67]: Tarantino created a whole new style of films.
example[68]: Many companies invest a lot of money in creating new products.
example[69]: Potter was famous for creating characters such as ‘Peter Rabbit’.
example[70]: This technique is used to create images of beautiful forests.
definition[17]: to make machines, cars, equipment etc in factories
definition[18]: to make very large quantities of something in a factory
example[72]: They developed a way to mass-produce the drug.
definition[19]: to design and make something new over a period of time
example[73]: In 1962, Enders developed an effective vaccine against measles.
example[74]: The company is developing new anti-virus software.
definition[20]: to make something as the result of a natural process or chemical reaction
example[75]: Hydrogen and oxygen combine to form water.
example[76]: The research will help us understand how planets are formed.
definition[21]: to make something such as heat, electricity, or power
example[77]: Wind can be used to generate electricity.
definition[22]: the name of a particular product or of the company that makes it
example[79]: It’s one of the most popular makes of satellite phone on the market.
definition[23]: to produce something by working or by using industrial processes
example[80]: The company makes and sells pumps and motors.
example[81]: a label on the toy read ‘ made in Taiwan’
example[82]: The purpose of this business is to make money.
example[83]: He expects to make $100,000 this year.
definition[24]: to earn the money you need to live
example[84]: He makes a good living selling used cars.
definition[25]: to make more or less money than you spend
example[85]: The company made a pretax profit of £309,000.
definition[26]: if a financial institution makes a market in particular shares etc, it has them available for people and organizations to buy at all times
example[86]: The company said it would no longer make a market in government securities.
definition[27]: if you make good on a promise or loan, you do what you promised or give back money that is owed
example[87]: How does Honda plan to make good its pledge?
example[88]: Pirelli intends to make good on any trading losses by its allies.
definition[28]: to be successful in a particular activity or business
example[89]: This is a tough business, but I hope you make it.
example[90]: He failed in his efforts to make it big in Los Angeles.
definition[29]: to cause either great success or complete failure
example[91]: They were well aware that large scale investment would make or break the company.
example[92]: This is a make-or-break year for us.
definition[30]: a particular name for a product made by a particular company
example[93]: The goods were the manufacturer’s own make.
example[94]: Its devices can work with many different makes of computer.
definition[31]: to be always trying to get an advantage for yourself
